origination.label: Creator

did.abstract: This collection contains issues of the Fletcher Security Review.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Issues from 2014 -- 2019 were transferred by Edwin Ginn Library, Fletcher School, February 2020, accession UP-2020-047.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection contains one series in chronological order.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Fletcher Security Review is the Security Studies Journal of The Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy, Tufts University. It is a print and online publication managed and edited by graduate students at the Fletcher School. The first issue was published in Winter 2014. The journal focuses on a theme for each issue, and these themes have included such topics as proxy wars, money and war, and emerging domains of security.

The Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy was established in 1933 by a bequest from Austin Barclay Fletcher, late president of the Board of Trustees and lifetime benefactor of Tufts. Fletcher's gift of $1,000,000 was intended to finance a school of law and diplomacy, but it was nearly ten years after his death before the Fletcher School opened its doors. When it did so, in the midst of the Great Depression and with the collaboration of Harvard University, the Fletcher School became the first graduate-only school of international affairs in the United States.

As of 2020, Fletcher enrolls approximately 700 students, from the United States and more than seventy countries around the world. Fletcher offers ten Master's degreen and PhD programs and over a dozen joint degree programs with other institutions across the United States and abroad.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Fletcher Security Review, 2014 -- 2019. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, in Feburary 2020.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains issues of the Fletcher Security Review.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish.
